label: A2B4C_mC28_15_f_2f_e-003
title: Li$_{2}$WO$_{4}$ (IV) Structure
comments:
Li$_{2}$WO$_{4}$ is found in a variety of phases at different pressures and temperatures (Yamaoka, 1973; Pistorius, 1975): 
 Li$_{2}$WO$_{4}$(I), which is in the \href{current_web_home_dir/A2B4C_hR42_148_2f_4f_f-001}{Phenakite ($S1_{3}$)} structure, is stable at low pressures and temperatures above 300$^\circ$C. 
 Tetragonal \href{current_web_home_dir/A2B4C_tI112_141_fg_2hi_h-001}{Li$_{2}$WO$_{4}$(II)} is the ground state, and is stable below a line from (300$^\circ$C, 0 kBar) to (650$^\circ$C, 2 kBar) to (550$^\circ$C, 12 kBar) to (380$^\circ$C, 15 kBar). 
 Orthorhombic Li$_{2}$WO$_{4}$(III) is the high temperature structure for all pressures above phases II and IV. Its exact crystal structure has not been determined.  It has been conjectured to be in space group $Pna2_{1}$ \#33, $Pnnm$ \#58 or $Cmmm$ \#65. 
 Monoclinic \href{current_web_home_dir/A2B4C_mC28_15_f_2f_e-003}{Li$_{2}$WO$_{4}$(IV)} (this structure), stable at pressures higher than phase II and temperatures lower than phase III. 
 Later (H\"{a}mmer, 2022) determined the structure of \href{current_web_home_dir/}{triclinic Li$_{2}$WO$_{4}$ (V)} (this structure), which may be the phase (Belyaev, 1961) observed at ambient pressure above 660$^\circ$C. 
 The measured sample of phase IV was synthesized at 40 kBar and 850$^\circ$C. 
  (Horiuchi, 1980) state that this structure is similar to \href{current_web_home_dir/AB4C_mP12_13_e_2g_f-003}{wolframite}. 
 \href{current_web_home_dir/A2B4C_mC28_15_f_2f_e-003}{Li$_{2}$WO$_{4}$(IV)} and \href{current_web_home_dir/A2B4C_mC28_15_f_2f_e-004}{H$_{2}$SO$_{4}$} have the same AFLOW prototype label, A2B4C\_mC28\_15\_f\_2f\_e. They are generated by the same symmetry operations with different sets of parameters ({\tt --params}) specified in their corresponding CIF files.
